header: ---background-ends---ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CR. BAIL APPLICATION No.52/2019 (Dattatraya Nandkumar Khavale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­00288­2019

arguments.text:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CR. BAIL APPLICATION No.52/2019 (Dattatraya Nandkumar Khavale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­00288­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 on his arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Sagar Ashok Shende, suspecting applicant's involvement in the C.R.No. 54/2019 for the offence pun/u/S. 307, 364, 392, 397, 298, 452, 143, 147, 149, 427, 510, 323 and u/Sec. 3/25, 30 of Arms Act. 
---background-ends---
2) Applicant was arrested in above mentioned crime on 18.01.2018, they are in Magisterial Custody from 22.01.2019. It is stated that, applicant is falsely implicated in the present case, he has not committed the alleged offence. It is further contended that, applicant is studying in 12th std., and about to face his finals. He is permanent resident on the given address. It is further contended that, applicant undertakes to make himself available for interrogation by police as and when required, hence, prayed for releasing him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CR.

BAIL APPLICATION No.52/2019 (Dattatraya Nandkumar Khavale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­00288­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 on his arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Sagar Ashok Shende, suspecting applicant's involvement in the C.R.No.

---background-ends---
2) Applicant was arrested in above mentioned crime on 18.01.2018, they are in Magisterial Custody from 22.01.2019.
It is stated that, applicant is falsely implicated in the present case, he has not committed the alleged offence.
It is further contended that, applicant is studying in 12th std., and about to face his finals.
He is permanent resident on the given address.
It is further contended that, applicant undertakes to make himself available for interrogation by police as and when required, hence, prayed for releasing him on bail.

arguments.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh.5 and resisted the application on the grounds that, applicant and his associates have damaged the car of informant and upon his questioning, after some hot exchange of words there was assault on the informant and his brother and caused injuries to them. It is contended that, the associates of this applicant have used rifle to threaten the informant and witness. It is contended that, still 4 to 5 accused are to be arrested. Hence, prayed for rejection of the application.

argumentSentences.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh.5 and resisted the application on the grounds that, applicant and his associates have damaged the car of informant and upon his questioning, after some hot exchange of words there was assault on the informant and his brother and caused injuries to them.
It is contended that, the associates of this applicant have used rifle to threaten the informant and witness.
It is contended that, still 4 to 5 accused are to be arrested.
Hence, prayed for rejection of the application.

arguments.text: 4) It is submitted that, accused is not at all concern with the alleged crime, he had been to the spot with a view to make inquiry and on suspicion, he was apprehended as his image was reflected in CCTV footage. It is submitted that, accused is studying in 1st year of decree course. It is pointed out that, no allegations are there against this accused in FIR. Accused is in Police Custody for 3 days, hence, whatever interrogation was required to be made with this accused is made and his further custody is no more required to the investigating machinery, accused is ready to abide the conditions imposed.

argumentSentences.text: 4) It is submitted that, accused is not at all concern with the alleged crime, he had been to the spot with a view to make inquiry and on suspicion, he was apprehended as his image was reflected in CCTV footage.
It is submitted that, accused is studying in 1st year of decree course.
It is pointed out that, no allegations are there against this accused in FIR.

Accused is in Police Custody for 3 days, hence, whatever interrogation was required to be made with this accused is made and his further custody is no more required to the investigating machinery, accused is ready to abide the conditions imposed.

arguments.text: 5) On perusal of FIR, it doesn't reflect role of this applicant in the crime. Admittedly, he was apprehended on suspicion. Whether he is involved or not has not been clarified. As the accused was in police custody for 3 days, there was sufficient opportunity to the police to make interrogation with the accused. Further more, the reason is required to be considered that accused is appearing for the examination of his degree course. Hence, accused may be released on bail by imposing conditions.

argumentSentences.text: 5) On perusal of FIR, it doesn't reflect role of this applicant in the crime.
Admittedly, he was apprehended on suspicion.
Whether he is involved or not has not been clarified.
As the accused was in police custody for 3 days, there was sufficient opportunity to the police to make interrogation with the accused.
Further more, the reason is required to be considered that accused is appearing for the examination of his degree course.
Hence, accused may be released on bail by imposing conditions.

order.text: ORDER 1) Crim. Misc. Application 52 of 2019 is allowed. 2) Applicant Dattatraya Nandkumar Khavale be released bail on their furnishing personal bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Five Thousand) with one or more surety/ies, till filing of charge­sheet on following terms & conditions : a) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. b) Applicant shall make available himself and co­ operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. c) Applicant shall not leave Satara City without prior permission of the I.O. d) Bail in Trial Court.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 1st February, 2019 Satara
processedText:
---background-ends---ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CR. BAIL APPLICATION No.52/2019 (Dattatraya Nandkumar Khavale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­00288­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 on his arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Sagar Ashok Shende, suspecting applicant's involvement in the C.R.No. 54/2019 for the offence pun/u/S. 307, 364, 392, 397, 298, 452, 143, 147, 149, 427, 510, 323 and u/Sec. 3/25, 30 of Arms Act. 
---background-ends---
2) Applicant was arrested in above mentioned crime on 18.01.2018, they are in Magisterial Custody from 22.01.2019. It is stated that, applicant is falsely implicated in the present case, he has not committed the alleged offence. It is further contended that, applicant is studying in 12th std., and about to face his finals. He is permanent resident on the given address. It is further contended that, applicant undertakes to make himself available for interrogation by police as and when required, hence, prayed for releasing him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh.5 and resisted the application on the grounds that, applicant and his associates have damaged the car of informant and upon his questioning, after some hot exchange of words there was assault on the informant and his brother and caused injuries to them. It is contended that, the associates of this applicant have used rifle to threaten the informant and witness. It is contended that, still 4 to 5 accused are to be arrested. Hence, prayed for rejection of the application. 
---argument-ends---
4) It is submitted that, accused is not at all concern with the alleged crime, he had been to the spot with a view to make inquiry and on suspicion, he was apprehended as his image was reflected in CCTV footage. It is submitted that, accused is studying in 1st year of decree course. It is pointed out that, no allegations are there against this accused in FIR. Accused is in Police Custody for 3 days, hence, whatever interrogation was required to be made with this accused is made and his further custody is no more required to the investigating machinery, accused is ready to abide the conditions imposed. 
---argument-ends---
5) On perusal of FIR, it doesn't reflect role of this applicant in the crime. Admittedly, he was apprehended on suspicion. Whether he is involved or not has not been clarified. As the accused was in police custody for 3 days, there was sufficient opportunity to the police to make interrogation with the accused. Further more, the reason is required to be considered that accused is appearing for the examination of his degree course. Hence, accused may be released on bail by imposing conditions. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Crim. Misc. Application 52 of 2019 is allowed. 2) Applicant Dattatraya Nandkumar Khavale be released bail on their furnishing personal bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Five Thousand) with one or more surety/ies, till filing of charge­sheet on following terms & conditions : a) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. b) Applicant shall make available himself and co­ operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. c) Applicant shall not leave Satara City without prior permission of the I.O. d) Bail in Trial Court. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 1st February, 2019 Satara
